DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Studying sample blood tumor tissue patient cancer laboratory may help doctor learn change occur DNA identify biomarkers related cancer . PURPOSE : This research study study biomarkers tissue blood sample patient early-stage non-small cell lung cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Biomarkers Tissue Blood Samples From Patients With Early-Stage Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Evaluate aberrant methylation pattern tissue serum sample patient early-stage non-small cell lung cancer ( NSCLC ) validate Johns Hopkins single institutional study . - Attempt define subgroup patient great risk recurrent metastatic disease may benefit aggressive adjuvant therapeutic regimen . - Develop prognostic indicator disease-specific overall survival . - Define new potential molecular target therapy . OUTLINE : Archived tumor intrathoracic lymph node tissue sample analyze aberrant DNA methylation ( p16/CDKN2A , DAP kinase , H-cadherin , APC , RASSF1A ) methylation-specific PCR . Analyses compare preliminary data Johns Hopkins institutional study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Diagnosis earlystage nonsmall cell lung cancer T1 T2 , N0 disease Had lobectomy great resection negative surgical margin ( R0 resection ) Available tumor lymph node specimens patient enrol ACOSOGZ0040 ACOSOGZ0030 trial Nodenegative recurrent disease within 3 year ( case ) Nodenegative patient without recurrent disease ( control ) PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics
DOC.keyword: stage I non-small cell lung cancer
stage II non-small cell lung cancer
